text.section:
In an investigation under this subtitle, the Attorney General, a deputy attorney general, or any assistant attorney general whom the Attorney General designates may:
issue a subpoena for the attendance of a witness to testify or the production of evidence;
administer oaths; and
examine witnesses.
The laws that relate to civil actions govern the attendance and compensation of witnesses in an investigation under this subtitle.
If a person fails to comply with a subpoena or refuses to testify about a material matter, on petition of the Attorney General, a circuit court may compel compliance with the subpoena.
